title: Air India crash probe focuses on actions of plane's captain, Wall Street Journal reports
Florida man sues NC casino after $500K in winnings withheld, lifetime ban
US says 'specific steps' agreed to end Syria violence after Israeli strikes hit Damascus
description: Israel says it is "working to save our Druze brothers", but Syria accuses it of "treacherous aggression".

title: Who are the Druze and why is Israel attacking Syria?
description: A fresh wave of deadly sectarian violence has rocked Syria, highlighting the country's fragile security landscape.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Japan’s exports fall for second straight month with no U.S. trade deal in sight, raising recession fears
description: The decrease in exports was a reversal of the 0.5% rise expected by economists polled by Reuters, and comes amid a lack of a breakthrough in trade talks with the U.S.

title: Trading in Japan's Seven & i halted after Couche-Tard withdraws $47 billion bid to acquire the retailer
description: Canadian retailer Alimentation Couche-Tard announced on Wednesday that it is pulling its $47 billion takeover offer for Japan's Seven & i Holdings.

title: US Court Says Would Block Trump's Birthright Citizenship Order Nationwide
description: A federal judge in Maryland could soon become the second to block President order restricting from taking effect nationwide, if an appeals court were to allow it.

title: "It's Just Better": Trump Says Coca-Cola To Switch To Cane Sugar In US
description: Beverage giant Coca-Cola has agreed to use real cane sugar in its US production, President Donald Trump announced Wednesday on social media.

title: As Iran Deports a Million Afghans, ‘Where Do We Even Go?’
description: Afghans being forced out of Iran are grappling with an uncertain future in Afghanistan, where widespread poverty and severe restrictions on women and girls await.
author: Elian Peltier, Farnaz Fassihi, Yaqoob Akbary and Jim Huylebroek

title: At Least 20 Killed in Stampede Outside a Gaza Aid Site
description: There were conflicting accounts from Palestinian and aid officials over what happened at the food distribution hub run by the Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation.
author: Lara Jakes and Nader Ibrahim

title: Sudanese paramilitary RSF accused of killing almost 300 people in village raids
description: Rights group says targets of Rapid Support Forces in North Kordofan were ‘empty of military objectives’Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) have killed nearly 300 people in attacks in North Kordofan state that began on Saturday, according to Sudanese activists.The RSF has been fighting the Sudanese army in the area, one of the key frontlines of a civil war in Sudan that has raged since April 2023. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi and agencies

title: France signals willingness to discuss reparations for colonial massacres in Niger
description: Exclusive: French government says it is open to dialogue but does not acknowledge responsibility in letter seen by the Guardian More than a century after its troops burned villages and looted cultural artefacts in the quest to include Niger in its west African colonial portfolio, France has signalled willingness over possible restitution, but is yet to acknowledge responsibility.“France remains open to bilateral dialogue with the Nigerien authorities, as well as to any collaboration concerning provenance research or patrimonial cooperation,” the office of France’s permanent representative to the UN wrote in a document seen by the Guardian. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Abidjan

title: Israel bombs Damascus, stoking conflict with Syria’s new government
description: Syrian troops are trying to intervene in sectarian violence in the south between the Druze minority and Bedouins. Israel said its strikes were to protect the Druze.
author: Salwan Georges, Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Abbie Cheeseman

title: Ultra-Orthodox party quits Israeli coalition, weakening Netanyahu
description: The Shas party said it would resign over the government’s failure to enshrine into law the long-standing military exemption for the ultra-Orthodox community.
author: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka

title: Sweet deal? Donald Trump claims Coca-Cola has agreed to use 'real' cane sugar in US drinks; company responds
description: Donald Trump announced on Truth Social that Coca-Cola has agreed to replace high-fructose corn syrup with real cane sugar in its US soft drinks, following his request. Coca-Cola acknowledged Trump's support but didn't confirm the change. The potential switch sparks debate over economic impacts and health implications, as Trump's history with Diet Coke adds intrigue.
author: TOI Business Desk

title: US-Middle East relations: Donald Trump hosts Gulf leaders at White House; Bahrain announces $17 billion in deals
description: Amidst renewed Middle East peace doubts and escalating violence in Syria, President Trump welcomed Bahrain's Crown Prince and Qatar's Prime Minister to the White House. Discussions centered on strengthening economic ties, highlighted by Bahrain's $17 billion investment in the US. Simultaneously, escalating conflict in Syria prompted Israeli strikes, raising regional tensions and underscoring the complexities of achieving stability.
author: TOI World Desk
